gain or loss","Slowed or Increased heart rate","Sensitivity to heat or cold"]","designer":{"xLocation":900,"yLocation":120,"listStyle":3,"next":"3a311419819e-6b44d21cf16f555d-4c53"},"text":"Symptom gain or loss","targetStepId":"225946c37405-7c8aaccd8d0e1466-32cc"},{"value":"Slowed or Increased heart rate","targetStepId":"7e10bd1f3f30-db06b28af136660b-b5d1"},{"value":"Sensitivity to heat or cold","targetStepId":"b408bcac6712-60acf6ed5d09ab3c-5767"}],"condition":"${SC}.entity"},{"id":"642ef6f36bf0-f57e134d56b70b64-632b","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":1220,"yLocation":340},"text":"Default","stringId":"stringId_7a1920d61156abc0"},{"id":"9efa7cccfba3-8c92d810c9ee0923-34c8","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":800,"yLocation":354},"text":"Fatigue is a nearly universal symptom of hypothyroidism","stringId":"stringId_d591387bac0cd136"},{"id":"225946c37405-7c8aaccd8d0e1466-32cc","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":886,"yLocation":380},"text":"An overactive thyroid (hyperthyroidism) makes you sweat more,lose weight. 
An underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism) does the opposite.","stringId":"stringId_0af928fd676df5fb"},{"id":"7e10bd1f3f30-db06b28af136660b-b5d1","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":1012,"yLocation":367},"text":"Hypothyroidism can cause a slow heart rate.
Hyperthyroidism stimulates the heart's pacemaker (sinoatrial node), increasing the intrinsic rate of the heart","stringId":"stringId_49d99174a96450e4"},{"id":"b408bcac6712-60acf6ed5d09ab3c-5767","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":1120,"yLocation":340},"text":"An overactive thyroid (hyperthyroidism) can cause a person to feel too hot, while an underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism) can cause a person to feel too cold.","stringId":"stringId_a4423a9105d8ea99"},{"id":"e021e927d23a-3af1338b647868da-aaa2","type":"branch","condition":"scenario.help.index == 1
","designer":{"xLocation":426,"yLocation":100,"next":"e1bb84304706-3f4d4fca04a519ec-03b2","reverse":false},"targetStepId":"4cdc8fd8a914-c423be41aacb8345-8aac"},{"id":"4cdc8fd8a914-c423be41aacb8345-8aac","type":"prompt","dataType":"["T4","TSH","T3"]","designer":{"xLocation":500,"yLocation":226,"listStyle":3,"next":"533c0697a855-7374d2197042a6ac-3756"},"text":"Tests to confirm your symptoms","variable":"Tests","submitTitle":"Submit","maxRetries":2,"stringId":"stringId_2f66ecbfa5370c00","choiceType":"choice"},{"id":"533c0697a855-7374d2197042a6ac-3756","type":"switch","designer":{"xLocation":540,"yLocation":290,"next":"f5510f2660e8-cb6bc1fbe36a3cda-9dd0"},"cases":[{"value":"T4","targetStepId":"4485ae951c6e-4f94afe8fb508860-5aa1"},{"value":"TSH","targetStepId":"6ece44777f75-9574b3c033e9c93c-e1a2"},{"value":"T3","targetStepId":"3324ad09174a-4f494279fae10429-8795"}],"condition":"${Tests}.entity"},{"id":"4485ae951c6e-4f94afe8fb508860-5aa1","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":480,"yLocation":428},"text":"A T4 test measures the blood level of the hormone T4, also known as thyroxine, which is produced by the thyroid gland and helps control metabolism and growth.","stringId":"stringId_54434f7e26ee1e87"},{"id":"6ece44777f75-9574b3c033e9c93c-e1a2","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":580,"yLocation":430},"text":"TSH stands for thyroid stimulating hormone. A TSH test is a blood test that measures this hormone.","stringId":"stringId_7bc421f30aa4a653"},{"id":"3324ad09174a-4f494279fae10429-8795","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":700,"yLocation":431},"text":"A T3 test is most often used to diagnose hyperthyroidism, a condition in which the body makes too much thyroid hormone.","stringId":"stringId_7207618993c334d5"},{"id":"f5510f2660e8-cb6bc1fbe36a3cda-9dd0","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":700,"yLocation":340},"text":"Default","stringId":"stringId_7a1920d61156abc0"},{"id":"8bd02144ca22-e1d356af78009d81-f31f","type":"prompt","dataType":"["T3","T4","TSH"]","designer":{"xLocation":280,"yLocation":272,"listStyle":3,"next":"80e710a81d63-0987ef10449f31a9-9a11"},"text":"Interpreting test results","variable":"ITR","submitTitle":"Submit","maxRetries":2,"stringId":"stringId_e1a8f222b26f84a8","choiceType":"choice"},{"id":"80e710a81d63-0987ef10449f31a9-9a11","type":"switch","designer":{"xLocation":288,"yLocation":352,"next":"dff0960ea588-8c3d494db19aaf7b-1072"},"cases":[{"value":"T3","targetStepId":"664596d51792-e1d0b2786701faed-4562"},{"value":"T4","targetStepId":"05565c97cf09-356aace8d1edeecd-6777"},{"value":"TSH","targetStepId":"1f1a6d44bda9-c8ec28132a742610-d93d"}],"condition":"${ITR}.entity","label":""},{"id":"05565c97cf09-356aace8d1edeecd-6777","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":260,"yLocation":480},"text":"The free T4 index includes a formula that compares free and bound T4.
High levels of any of these tests (total T4, free T4, or free T4 index) may indicate an overactive thyroid, also known as hyperthyroidism.
Low levels of any of these tests (total T4, free T4, or free T4 index) may indicate an underactive thyroid, also known as hypothyroidism.","stringId":"stringId_2049484a90b4b8a2"},{"id":"1f1a6d44bda9-c8ec28132a742610-d93d","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":371,"yLocation":472},"text":"Some suggest that TSH levels of over 2.5 milliunits per liter (mU/L) are abnormal, while others consider levels of TSH to be too high only after they have reached 4 to 5 mU/L.","stringId":"stringId_b7fc04c8aadedb97"},{"id":"664596d51792-e1d0b2786701faed-4562","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":160,"yLocation":480},"text":"If your results show high total T3 levels or high free T3 levels, it may mean you have hyperthyroidism. Low T3 levels may mean you have hypothyroidism, a condition in which your body doesn't make enough thyroid hormone.","stringId":"stringId_1e8cdac3d4116a27"},{"id":"e1bb84304706-3f4d4fca04a519ec-03b2","type":"branch","condition":"scenario.help.index == 2","designer":{"xLocation":220,"yLocation":180,"next":"d9f4d64619fb-caf43c722a196af8-3b07"},"targetStepId":"8bd02144ca22-e1d356af78009d81-f31f"},{"id":"d9f4d64619fb-caf43c722a196af8-3b07","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":80,"yLocation":260},"text":"Others","stringId":"stringId_52ef9633d88a7480"},{"id":"dff0960ea588-8c3d494db19aaf7b-1072","type":"statement","designer":{"xLocation":430,"yLocation":340},"text":"default","stringId":"stringId_7a1920d61156abc0"}],"breaking":false,"interrupting":false,"returningMessage":"Please wait"}
